articles.title: FM Spokesman on Russian Vice-Foreign Minister's Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
FM Spokesman on Russian Vice-Foreign Minister's Visit to DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Tuesday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards the DPRK visit by the vice foreign minister of Russia and his party:
					 Aleksei Borodavkin, vice foreign minister of Russia and head of the Russian side to the six-party talks, and his party visited the DPRK from March 11 to 14.
					
					 During the visit the vice foreign minister of Russia paid a courtesy call on DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, met with the first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs and the vice-minister of Foreign Affairs in charge of Russian affairs and had an in-depth exchange of views on the issue of boosting the bilateral relations, the situation on the Korean Peninsula and the region, the issue of resuming the six-party talks and other matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Both sides discussed the issues of boosting the traditional friendly relations between the two countries and further reenergizing bilateral cooperation in the political, economic and other multifaceted fields this significant year marking the 10th anniversary of the publication of the historic DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration.
					
					 The Russian side expressed concern over the increasing tension on the Korean Peninsula. It stressed that the tripartite economic cooperation projects including the laying of railways, gas pipeline and a transmission line linking Russia with the north and the south of Korea have a special prospect in the aspect of actively helping improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The DPRK side expressed support for the projects of the Russian side for tripartite economic cooperation and manifested its willingness to positively examine the proposal for tripartite working negotiations for their implementation if it is advanced.
					
					 The Russian side expressed its stand that the six-party talks should be resumed at an early date to settle the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula in a political and diplomatic manner. It pointed out that it is important to take constructive measures such as DPRK's moratorium on nuclear test and ballistic missile launch, access of IAEA experts to uranium enrichment facilities in the Nyongbyon area and discussion of the issue of uranium enrichment at the six-party talks.
					
					 The DPRK side expressed its stand that it can go out to the six-party talks without any precondition, it is not opposed to the discussion of the above-said issue at the six-party talks and if the talks are resumed, other issues raised by the Russian side can be also discussed and settled in the course of implementing the September 19 Joint Statement calling for the denuclearization of the whole Korean Peninsula on the principle of simultaneous action.
					
					 Beneficial were negotiations held in an atmosphere of mutual respect and trust.

articles.title: DPRK Delegate on His Country's Stand on Elimination of Nukes
articles.content:
DPRK Delegate on His Country's Stand on Elimination of Nukes
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea will as ever make every possible effort to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and promote the nuclear disarmament and the final elimination of nuclear weapons in the world.
					 The DPRK's delegate said this in a speech at a plenary meeting of the Geneva Disarmament Conference on March 10.
					
					 The issue of providing a guarantee for an unconditional non-use of nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states presents itself as an urgent one in view of the objective of the nuclear disarmament, he noted, and continued:
					
					 It is an escape from reality to pursue only non-proliferation, sidestepping the issue of providing a guarantee for an unconditional non-use of nukes. 
					
					 The high-handed nuclear policy based on double standards reduces disarmament agreements including the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty to mere scraps of papers and drives the world into a nuclear arms race at present.
					
					 It is unjustifiable for some countries to blame only those countries incurring their displeasure for conducting nuclear activities for peaceful purposes, while evading their commitments to nuclear disarmament. 
					
					 Using nuclear energy for peaceful purposes is not a privilege granted to specified countries only. It is a legitimate right of sovereign states.
					
					 The reality proves that the existing commitment to giving a guarantee for non-use and safety of nukes alone can never help solve the problem. 
					
					 It is our view that it is most urgent, therefore, to set up a mechanism under international law totally banning the threat with nukes and their use.
					
					 It is our view that to this end it is necessary to institute an international convention banning the use of nukes which calls for  stipulating it as a legal duty of nuclear weapons states to neither threaten with nukes nor use them under any circumstances and making a strict verification of its observance.
					
					 All the nuclear weapons states should roll back nuclear policies based on preemptive use of nukes, unconditionally commit themselves not to use nukes first as demanded by the non-nuclear states and respond to the negotiations for working out the international convention on this issue as early as possible.
					
					 We will always sincerely fulfill our duty before the international community as a responsible nuclear weapons state.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau has issued two sheetlets to mark the 50th anniversary of the treaty on friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance between the DPRK and China.
					 The sheetlets carry photos of President Kim Il Sung meeting with Chairman Mao Zedong, and other photos of Chinese revolutionaries of elder generations.
					
					 Also seen in the stamps are national flags and emblems of the two countries and letters "DPRK-China Friendship" written in Korean and Chinese languages.
					
					 The treaty was signed in Beijing on July 11, Juche 50 (1961).

articles.title: Ponghwa Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Ponghwa Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Many people are visiting the Ponghwa Revolutionary Site in Kangdong County, Pyongyang, on the occasion of the 94th anniversary of the Korean National Association (KNA).
					 Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement, stayed there from mid-March Juche 5 (1916) to November next year to make preparations for forming KNA and expanding it.
					
					 During the days he taught at Myongsin School, bringing up students as ardent patriots and conducting activities to develop the liberation movement.
					
					 He founded KNA, an underground organization, in Pyongyang to guide the liberation movement and expanded it, based on Ponghwa-ri.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung came to Ponghwa-ri in spring Juche 6 (1917) together with his mother Kang Pan Sok to stay with his father Kim Hyong Jik. 
					
					 In the revolutionary site there are a statue of Kim Hyong Jik, Myongsin School, his house, shallow well and the place of secret meetings in Mt. Ponghwa.
					
					 There are also the Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum and a monument to the revolutionary exploits of Kim Hyong Jik.

articles.title: Kyonghung Restaurant Enjoys Popularity
articles.content:
Kyonghung Restaurant Enjoys Popularity
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Kyonghung Restaurant in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang is always crowded with people.
					 The restaurant's menu includes Taedonggang beer, roast meat and cold noodle.
					
					 The Beer House, covering 2,000 square meters, serves seven kinds of barley and rice beer.
					
					 The restaurant also hosts wedding ceremonies, equipped with a souvenir shop, musical instruments and a mixer.
					
					 The Chophouse serves roast beef and duck usually and roast deer, roe deer, bear in holidays, as well as cold noodle. 
					
					 There are stands selling roast chestnut, roast sweet potato, peanut, twist and candy fluff outside the restaurant.

articles.title: 1,000-ri Journey for Learning
articles.content:
1,000-ri Journey for Learning
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Eighty-eight years has passed since President Kim Il Sung started a 1,000-ri (400 kilometers) journey for learning.
					 At that time, rich men's children went abroad from Korea to study and become civilized.
					
					 But the President, motivated by his father's remark that a Korean should experience the sufferings of the Korean nation and have a good knowledge of the Korean history and culture, left China for the homeland on March 16, Juche 12 (1923).
					
					 He made a long journey alone from Badaogou in Changbai County, China, to Mangyongdae, his birthplace, witnessing the situation of the homeland occupied by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 What he saw in the homeland were people in fetters and nomads, and what he heard were cries for vengeance on the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 After arriving in Mangyongdae, he started studying at Changdok School. During his school days, he was aware of the truth that it was possible only through fighting to drive the aggressors out of the country and liberate the nation.
					
					 Indeed, the journey enabled the President to have a better understanding of Korea and its people.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Doomed to Destruction--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Doomed to Destruction--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are the continuation and a revised version of the Team Spirit that had been ill famed as nuclear war exercises against the DPRK. The dangerous war saber-rattling has also been expanded systematically, posing a nuclear threat.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It cites facts to prove that Key Resolve originated from Team Spirit.  It says:
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle have become all the more vicious in their aggressive nature and provocative contents due to the U.S. policy of aggression towards the DPRK and the reckless actions of the south Korean ruling quarters following it.
					
					 This year's military drills were staged under the provocative OPLAN 5029 which was mapped out under the pretext of coping with what they called "contingency".
					
					 The trigger-happy elements at home and abroad made futile efforts to convince the public that those military drills are annual "defensive exercises". Such brazen-faced action will never work on anyone.
					
					 The confrontation and tensions have recently mounted higher between the armed forces of the north and the south due to the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities going against the trend of the times for dialogue and peace.
					
					 The war hysteria of the U.S. and the south Korean war-like forces aimed at the invasion of the DPRK remains unchanged and it has already gone beyond the tolerance limit.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean war-like forces' escalation of the tension aimed at a war will lead them to final destruction.

articles.title: S. Korean Minister's Anti-DPRK Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korean Minister's Anti-DPRK Remarks Blasted
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification of south Korea, at a recent seminar let loose a string of balderdash against the DPRK. He said that south Korea is "striving for dialogue, cooperation, peace and unification," adding that it is "very difficult" to improve the north-south relations. He also made confrontational remarks such as "leading the north to denuclearization and opening." He went the lengths of asserting that there cannot be debates on other issues as they are "hardcore task for peace" and "basic goal of the north policy."
					 Blasting his remarks, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary:
					
					 His remarks prove that the south Korean authorities have no willingness to mend the stalled north-south relations and only seek to harm and stifle the DPRK in league with foreign forces.
					
					 He is a top class criminal who should have stood a trial before the nation for his anti-reunification acts of treachery.
					
					 His recent malarkey stemmed from his poor calculation that he can keep a high profile of himself and thus keep his post as minister. 
					
					 He has made confrontational remarks whenever an opportunity presented itself, far from stepping down from his post. This clearly shows once again that he is a trouble-maker of the nation who escalates distrust and confrontation between the north and the south and blocks the north-south relations from making improvement.
					
					 No matter how desperately he may try to prolong his short remaining days, it will prove futile. He is bound to stand a stern judgment by history as he has chilled the aspiration of the fellow countrymen for reunification while laying hurdles in the way of improving the north-south relations.

articles.title: Putting Production of Consumer Goods on Modern, Scientific Basis Called for
articles.content:
Putting Production of Consumer Goods on Modern, Scientific Basis Called for
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday editorially calls upon all the people to turn out in a dynamic drive of great surge to put the production of consumer goods and the light industry on a modern and scientific basis and thus bring about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living and building a thriving nation this year.
					 This is an urgent demand for building an economic power, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 We have build up solid material and technical foundations for putting the production of consumer goods on a modern and scientific basis.
					
					 The heavy industry including the metal and chemical industries has made rapid progress. A vigorous drive has also been made to put the machine-building industry on a CNC basis. 
					
					 Only doing so would provide a way of producing more commodities favored by the people, immaculate by any standard and competitive on the world market, and consolidating the material and technical foundations of the light industry in a far-sighted way as required by the age of knowledge-based economy.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea is determined to put factories and enterprises in the field of the light industry on a modern basis, equip them with ultramodern facilities and carry on the production and management in conformity with scientific and technical demands in order to produce more quality light industrial goods.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Stage Anti-Terror Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Stage Anti-Terror Drill
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The 6th engineering brigade of the south Korean puppet army staged an anti-terror drill in Phochon, Kyonggi Province on March 11, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers kicked up the madcap war racket together with police and administrative organs under the pretext of coping with someone's "threat of terrorism".

articles.title: Resignation of Choe Si Jung Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resignation of Choe Si Jung Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) in a commentary on Mar. 9 demanded the resignation of the chairman of the Committee of Broadcasting Services and News Agency.
					The commentary accused the "Grand National Party" of making a decision to reappoint Choe Si Jung, chairman of the Committee of Broadcasting Services and News Agency, whose term of office is to expire on March 25.
					
					Recalling that he took the lead in helping Lee Myung Bak bring media under his control, the commentary noted: Due to his bad role a large number of citizens were subject to forced searches and arrested and put in custody for their media activities. This stoked a terror-ridden atmosphere. 
					
					For his past record ill-famed for activities to stamp out democracy and strengthen dictatorship Choe Si Jung cannot but be branded as a member of an action group for "government's" propaganda, the commentary held.
					
					The reappointment of Choe precisely means a move to reduce the committee to a mechanism for public security, the commentary noted, demanding him appear people's court.

articles.title: Map on Burial Places of Animals Affected by FMD Made Public in S. Korea
articles.content:
Map on Burial Places of Animals Affected by FMD Made Public in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A map showing the places where animals were buried for foot-and-mouth diseases was recently opened to public by netizens in south Korea. 
					 They worked out the map in protest against the present "government" which pressurized them not to open to public the burial places.
					
					 They asserted that the irresponsible management of the places will directly harm people because of the contamination of ground water and others. This is an issue related to the people's safety, they added.

articles.title: Prices Rise in South Korea
articles.content:
Prices Rise in South Korea
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Various prices have sharply jumped for the last three years since the present authorities came to power, according to the Citizens Federation for Economic Justice of south Korea on Mar. 7.
					According to it, cabbage price showed a 114. 2 percent increase while the prices of garlic, onion and pork jumped 89.8, 74.8 and 62.1 percent respectively in the period from February 2008 to February this year.
					
					Prices of petrol, foodstuff, fruits and others also skyrocketed.
					
					The federation said that right after taking office the present authorities selected 52 items directly related to the people's living and promised them to cut down their prices but failed to do so.

articles.title: Koreans in US Denounce South Korean Regime
articles.content:
Koreans in US Denounce South Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Koreans in the U.S. began demonstrations to judge the south Korean puppet government outside the south Korean embassy in the U.S. from Mar. 1, the 92nd anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising. They include the U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration. 
					 Prior to the demonstration they made public a declaration.
					
					 It accused the present south Korean regime of revealing its true colors as typical dictatorial regime since it took office. It gagged the just voices of the citizens through fascist suppression and shaped the policy in favor of financial tycoons, etc., quite contrary to the desire of the times, it added.
					
					 The regime also incited confrontation dating back to the Cold War era, sparked off the military clashes between the north and the south and blocked the peace on the Korean Peninsula and the prosperity of the nation, it deplored.
					
					 It said that the compatriot organizations in the U.S. would conduct a 100-day demonstration to force the Lee Myung Bak regime, ill famed to be incompetent, corrupt and self-righteous, to step down.

articles.title: DPRK's Measure for Self-defence Supported in Britain
articles.content:
DPRK's Measure for Self-defence Supported in Britain
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association, the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on March 9 in support of the second installment of a statement released by the inspection group of the DPRK National Defence Commission disclosing the truth behind the Yonphyong Island shelling case.
					 The statement disclosed that the Yonphyong Island shelling case was orchestrated by the south Korean authorities in a bid to preserve the illegal "northern limit line".
					
					 This was also prompted by the ulterior aim of the U.S. to stifle Korean-style socialism and hold its military hegemony in Northeast Asia, it said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK proposed to open the north-south high-level military talks despite the provocations by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group.
					
					 But the south Korean puppet group deliberately brought the preliminary talks for opening the north-south high-level military talks to collapse through plots and trickery.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group revealed their true colors as anti-DPRK confrontation maniacs. 
					
					 We friends of the DPRK in Britain and adherents to the Juche idea and the Songun idea express full support for the measures for self-defence taken by the DPRK to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 We are sure that the Korean People's Army, the revolutionary armed forces, will decisively frustrate all conspiratorial moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group to disturb peace under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the KPA.

articles.title: Earthquake Damage Increases in Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Damage Increases in Japan
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The damage caused by the disastrous earthquake that hit Japan on March 11 is on the steady increase. 
					NHK said that the quake left 2,476 people dead and more than 17,000 missing as of 9: 30 of Tuesday.
					
					About 1,000 dead bodies were found in the coastal areas of Oshika Peninsula of Miyagi Prefecture.
					
					The number of refugees reached 550,000 and there is an acute shortage of drinking water, foodstuff, petrol, etc. in the quake-stricken areas.
					
					 There were 194 aftershocks of magnitude of above 5 as of 9:00 AM on Mar. 14 after the earthquake.
					
					 The continued quakes are causing unceasing explosions of nuclear reactors.
					
					 The explosion of Reactor No. 3 at the Fukushima nuclear power plant on Mar. 14 was followed by the explosion of Reactor No. 2 at the power plant on the following day.
					
					 From the evening of Mar. 14, fuel rods that measure about 4 meters were completely exposed due to the lack of cooling water in the Reactor No. 2, according to the Tokyo Electric Power Co.
					
					 The amount of radiation again went beyond its limit in the compound of the nuclear power plant, prompting the company to inform the whole country of the emergency situation.
					
					 Two Japanese at work at the power plant and 17 helicopter crews of a U.S. carrier engaged in the rescue activities were confirmed to have been contaminated by radiation.
					
					 According to foreign news, Fukushima is turning into a ghost-like city due to a series of explosions of reactors.
					
					 Public establishments including banks and post offices were closed and sirens are being heard in every street, stoking a tense atmosphere.
					
					 Many horror-stricken people are leaving the city and roads are almost blocked as refugees and trucks are crowding the place about 50 km away from the city.

articles.title: Jobless Claims Rise in US
articles.content:
Jobless Claims Rise in US
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The number of Americans initially applying for unemployment aid last week was 397,000 in the week ending March 5, the U.S. Labor Department said Thursday quoting statistical data.
					 This is an increase of 26,000 from the prior week's revised figure.

articles.title: Step for Compulsory Education Taken by China
articles.content:
Step for Compulsory Education Taken by China
 Beijing, March 13 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Education of China adopted a memorandum on the balanced development of compulsory education together with people's governments of 15 provinces, autonomous regions and municipalities in Beijing on March 9.
					 State Councilor Liu Yandong underscored the need to push forward the standardization of the construction of the schools which introduce compulsory education and make a balanced distribution of teachers, facilities, books, school buildings, etc. in a bid to comprehensively improve the quality of education.

articles.title: US Gunrunning into Mexico Is Unacceptable--Mexican Senate
articles.content:
US Gunrunning into Mexico Is Unacceptable--Mexican Senate
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Senate on Mar. 10 called a hearing over reports that U.S. agents allowed guns to be smuggled into Mexico as part of investigations into drug traffickers.
					 CBS News and the nonprofit Center for Public Integrity reported that agents of the U.S. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives investigating gunrunning by cartels allowed hundreds of guns purchased in the U.S. to go into Mexico.
					
					 "Carrying out this type of operation in our country is unacceptable. It violates trust and also undermines national sovereignty," said Sen. Luis Alberto Villarreal, a member of President Felipe Calderon's National Action Party.

articles.title: South African Minister Condemns European Airport Taxes
articles.content:
South African Minister Condemns European Airport Taxes
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- South Africa's Tourism Minister spoke against an airport tax system which primarily benefits European Union countries.
					 He said some economists have estimated that if one added up all the airport taxes in some cases it almost amounts to 50 percent of the entire cost of an airline ticket. "Someone must take a stand and put pressure on these governments to consider their stance," he said.
					
					 Initially European countries had said the taxes were for green gas   emission and pollution, but the money directly goes back to European budgets to deal with their budget deficits, he said.

articles.title: Civil Military Service Law Adopted in Myanmar
articles.content:
Civil Military Service Law Adopted in Myanmar
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Myanmar has recently enacted a civil military service law and every citizen has duty to undergo military training in accord with the provisions of the law, said the current attorney-general of Myanmar on Mar. 11. 
					 Every citizen has the duty to safeguard independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country, he stressed.

articles.title: Violence against Women Still Serious Problem in Georgia
articles.content:
Violence against Women Still Serious Problem in Georgia
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Violence against women still remains a serious problem in Georgia.
					 One in every three women in Georgia was a victim of violence, be it physical, psychological or sexual, according to the results of the 2010 survey published by the National Network of Protection from Violence, a NGO in Georgia.

articles.title: Manila Strengthens Monitoring of Commodity Prices
articles.content:
Manila Strengthens Monitoring of Commodity Prices
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Philippine government has strengthened its monitoring on the prices of basic necessities and prime commodities.
					 On March 10, the government of the country declared it would deploy additional employees from its regional and provincial officers and head offices to survey markets nationwide, monitor and regulate the prices of basic goods.

articles.title: Anecdotes about Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Anecdotes about Kim Jong Il 
Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- On March 17, Juche 86 (1997) leader Kim Jong Il published a famous work "On Learning from the Revolutionary Soldier Spirit".
					 From that time on, the revolutionary soldier spirit has become the ideological feeling of all the Korean people and their treasured sword for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					 The main point of the spirit is the spirit of devotedly guarding the leader, thoroughly implementing his orders and braving any sacrifice.
					
					 It was in this spirit that the DPRK launched satellites, made signal scientific and technological achievement, including CNC and nuclear fusion technologies, and set up new iron, vinalon and fertilizer production systems based on locally available materials and fuel. 
					
					 When the United States and its allies were advertising "possible collapse of the socialist system in north Korea" and the world people were afraid for its rigorous situation, the Korean people brought about a great upsurge in economic sectors with a firm conviction of their victory. The song they sang at that time is "We Will Defend the Leadership of the Revolution at the Cost of Our Lives" and the slogan they held high is "Let us go the thorny path cheerfully!" 
					
					 Through their experience, they have become convinced that the revolutionary soldier spirit makes it possible for them to accelerate the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Delegado coreano aboga por la abolicion total de armas nucleares
articles.content:
Delegado coreano aboga por la abolicion total de armas nucleares
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ATCC) -- En adelante tambien, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hara todos los esfuerzos posibles por realizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana y promover el desarme nuclear y la abolicion total de armas nucleares en el ambito mundial. 
					Dijo el delegado de la RPDC en su discurso pronunciado el dia 10 en la sesion plenaria de la Conferencia de Ginebra sobre el Desarme. 
					
					El ofrecimiento de la garantia incondicional de no uso de las armas nucleares a los Estados desnuclearizados es un problema apremiante en el punto de vista del objetivo del desarme nuclear, dijo y continuo:
					
					Dar espaldas a este asunto y perseguir solo la no proliferacion nuclear significa la evasion de la realidad.
					
					Hoy dia, la politica de despotismo nuclear basada en la pauta de doble rasero invalida los convenios de desarme como el Tratado de No Proliferacion y acarrea una carrera armamentista nuclear al mundo. 
					
					Cuestionar las actividades nucleares con fines pacificos de otros paises que no le obedecen, incumpliendo con su deber de desarme nuclear, es un acto injustificable en ningun caso. 
					
					  El uso pacifico de energia nuclear no es un privilegio para algunos paises especificos, sino es un derecho legitimo de los Estados soberanos. 
					
					  La realidad muestra que la existente garantia de no usar las armas nucleares no puede resolver nunca el problema. 
					
					  Por lo tanto, consideramos que la prioridad es instituir un aparato internacional que prohiba estrictamente la amenaza de armas nucleares y su uso. 
					
					  Para este fin, es preciso concertar un convenio internacional sobre la prohibicion de uso de armas nucleares, que estipule como deber legal de paises con armas nucleares no ejercer alguna amenaza con armas nucleares ni usarlas en cualquier situacion y acompane la revision rigurosa sobre este tema. 
					
					  Todos los paises con armas nucleares deben abandonar la politica nuclear basada en el ataque preventivo nuclear, comprometer incondicionalmente el no uso de ataque preventivo, como demandan los Estados desnuclearizados, e iniciar cuanto antes las negociaciones para elaborar un convenio internacional sobre el respecto. 
					
					  La RPDC, siendo un pais responsable con armas nucleares, cumplira con toda sinceridad su mision asumida ante la sociedad internacional.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX se refiere a la visita de vicecanciller ruso a Corea
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX se refiere a la visita de vicecanciller ruso a Corea 
						
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ATCC) -- Con respecto a la reciente visita del vicecanciller ruso y su comitiva a Corea, el portavoz del MINREX de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 15 la siguiente respuesta a la ATCC:
					Alexei Borodavkin, viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Rusia y jefe de la parte rusa a las conversaciones a 6 bandas, y su comitiva realizaron una visita a Corea desde el dia 11 al 14. 
					
					Durante su estancia, el visitante hizo una visita de cortesia al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y converso con el primer vicecanciller y el vicecanciller encargado de Rusia intercambiando profundas opiniones sobre el desarrollo de relaciones bilaterales, la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana  y la regional, la reanudacion de conversaciones a 6 bandas y otros problemas de interes mutuo. 
					
					En las ocasiones ambas partes discutieron los problemas para desarrollar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises en este ano significativo del 10o aniversario de publicacion de la historica Declaracion Corea-Rusia de Moscu y para activar la cooperacion bilateral en la politica, la economia y los demas planos.
					
					La parte rusa expreso su preocupacion por la tension agravante de la Peninsula Coreana e hizo hincapie en que los planes de cooperacion economica entre 3 partes como la construccion del ferrocarril, el gasoducto y la linea de transmision electrica, que unan a Rusia con el Norte y el Sur de Corea, tienen perspectivas especiales en el sentido de fomentar la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					La parte coreana manifesto su apoyo a los planes de la parte rusa sobre la cooperacion economica tripartita y expuso la voluntad de examinar positivamente si se presenta la propuesta de negociaciones de trabajo entre 3 partes para implementarlos.
					
					La parte rusa expreso su posicion de que se reanuden cuanto antes las conversaciones a 6 bandas para solucionar por via politica y diplomatica el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Y considero importante tomar las medidas constructivas tales como el cese provisional de pruebas nucleares y de lanzamiento de misiles balisticos por parte coreana, el acceso de los especialistas de la Agencia Internacional de Energia Atomica a las instalaciones de enriquecimiento de uranio en la zona de Nyongbyon, la discusion de esta actividad nuclear en las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
					
					La parte coreana dejo en claro su posicion de acudir incondicionalmente a las conversaciones a 6 bandas y no rechazar el debate del problema de enriquecimiento de uranio en el mismo espacio de dialogo. Y agrego que si se reanuda el dialogo, se discutiran y se resolveran otros temas planteados por la parte rusa en el curso de implementacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre que exige la desnuclearizacion de toda la Peninsula Coreana en el principio de accion simultanea.
					
					Resultaron provechosas las negociaciones Corea-Rusia transcurridas en el ambiente de mutuo respeto y confianza.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta nuevos dichos provocativos de Hyon In Thaek
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta nuevos dichos provocativos de Hyon In Thaek
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ATCC) -- El ministro de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, Hyon In Thaek, en un seminario reciente, dijo que ahora "se encuentran en la fase muy dificil" las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y las autoridades surcoreanas "se esfuerzan por el dialogo, la cooperacion, la paz y la reunificacion". Tras decir unas palabras provocativas como "desnuclearizar al Norte" e "inducirlo a la apertura exterior", insistio en que estas tareas son "metas indiscutibles de la paz y la politica sobre el Norte". 
					Tales disparates comprueban que las autoridades surcoreanas no tienen ni la minima voluntad de sacar de la crisis las relaciones intercoreanas sino acechan la oportunidad de calumniar y derrocar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras. 
					
					Revela el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue:
					
					Hyon es el criminal de pesima calana que debio ser castigado severamente por la nacion por sus crimenes anti-reunificacion cometidos en contra del pais y la nacion. 
					
					Los recientes dichos de el parten de intento estupido de mantenerse en su cargo dando destaque a su presencia. 
					
					Hyon, que debio renunciar a su cartera mucho antes, es un dolor de cabeza para la nacion coreana porque agrava la desconfianza y confrontacion entre el Norte y el Sur e impide la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					El sera enjuiciado severamente por la historia por haber sofocado la aspiracion nacional a la reunificacion abusando de su autoridad de ministro de Reunificacion.

articles.title: "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" son copias de "Team Spirit"
articles.content:
"Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" son copias de "Team Spirit"
						
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este martes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que los ejercicios militares conjuntos  "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" son la continuacion de "Team Spirit" conocido como ejercicio de guerra nuclear anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Las primeras maniobras, que parten de la segunda, vinieron ampliandose y recrudeciendose sistematicamente entranando los factores de guerra nuclear, destaca el articulista y continua:
					
					"Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" se tornaron cada vez mas agresivos y provocativos debido a la politica de EE.UU. de agredir a la RPDC y a los aventureros movimientos de los gobernantes surcoreanos que siguen al imperio.
					
					Este ano, se realizaron segun el provocativo "plan operacional 5029" elaborado bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a la supuesta "situacion de emergencia".
					
					Sin embargo, los belicistas internos y externos tratan de enganar a la opinion publica describiendolos como "entrenamientos anuales de defensa". Pero, este embuste no puede enganar a nadie.
					
					Debido a EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas que desafian a la corriente de dialogo y paz, se agravan mas que nunca la confrontacion entre las fuerzas armadas de ambas partes coreanas y la tension de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Ya paso el limite el belicismo de ellos que intentan invariablemente atacar a la RPDC.
					
					Si ellos optan por fin por la guerra, seran condenados a la destruccion definitiva.

articles.title: Restaurante Kyonghung
articles.content:
Restaurante Kyonghung
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Restaurante Kyonghung en el capitalino municipio de Pothonggang sirve a la clientela la cerveza de marca Taedonggang, carne asada, fideo en caldo frio y otros platos.
					En los quioscos del restaurante se venden castanas y patatas tostadas, mani, rosquillas, etc. 
					
					La cerveceria con 2 mil metros cuadrados del solar esta colmada de bebedores hasta en el invierno. 
					
					Aqui sirven 7 tipos de cerveza, especificamente, las hechas exclusivamente con cebada o arroz, las hechas agregando el arroz en 30, 50 y 70 por ciento y las negras de 15o y 10o.
					
					Lo peculiar del Restaurante Kyonghung es el servicio para la boda. 
					
					Estan instalados para los novios los quioscos de souvenir, los equipos de sonido, los instrumentos musicales, etc.
					
					En las fiestas, los clientes podran probar las carnes asadas de animales raros como corzo, ciervo y oso.
